title: Bell State Generator using Spontaneous Parametric Down-Conversion
description: Generates maximally entangled photon pairs in Bell states using Type-II SPDC in a BBO crystal with proper beam separation and polarization analysis.
physics_explanation: A 405nm pump laser undergoes Type-II SPDC in a BBO crystal, generating entangled photon pairs at 810nm where one photon has horizontal polarization and the other vertical. The crystal creates the Bell state |ψ⟩ = (|H⟩A|V⟩B + |V⟩A|H⟩B)/√2 due to conservation laws. Mirrors separate the SPDC cone into distinct spatial paths, and polarizers at 45° project both photons onto the same diagonal basis, enabling violation of Bell inequalities through coincidence measurements.

component_justifications.405nm Pump Laser: Provides blue pump photons with sufficient energy to generate two 810nm photons through energy conservation in SPDC process
component_justifications.Focusing Lens: Focuses pump beam into BBO crystal to increase interaction strength and SPDC conversion efficiency
component_justifications.BBO Crystal: Type-II Beta Barium Borate crystal generates entangled photon pairs where signal and idler have orthogonal polarizations
component_justifications.Pump Block Filter: Removes residual 405nm pump light immediately after crystal to prevent it from reaching detectors
component_justifications.Mirror 1: Redirects the upper cone of SPDC photons to create spatial separation between signal and idler beams
component_justifications.Mirror 2: Redirects the lower cone of SPDC photons to create the second distinct beam path for the idler photon
component_justifications.Collection Lens 1: Collects and collimates the signal photon in the upper path after mirror reflection
component_justifications.Collection Lens 2: Collects and collimates the idler photon in the lower path after mirror reflection
component_justifications.Polarizer A: Set at 45° to project photon A onto diagonal polarization basis for Bell state measurement
component_justifications.Polarizer B: Set at 45° to project photon B onto diagonal polarization basis for Bell state measurement
component_justifications.Bandpass Filter A: Narrow bandpass filter to select 810nm SPDC photons and eliminate background noise
component_justifications.Bandpass Filter B: Narrow bandpass filter to select 810nm SPDC photons and eliminate background noise
component_justifications.Coupling Lens A: Focuses photons onto the active area of SPAD detector A for efficient detection
component_justifications.Coupling Lens B: Focuses photons onto the active area of SPAD detector B for efficient detection
component_justifications.SPAD Detector A: Single-photon avalanche photodiode with precise timing for coincidence detection of entangled photons
component_justifications.SPAD Detector B: Second SPAD detector enabling coincidence counting to verify quantum correlations and Bell inequality violation

expected_outcome: Coincidence detection rates will show strong correlations violating classical limits, with visibility >70% confirming Bell state entanglement when polarizers are rotated through different angles for Bell inequality tests.
